title: Holly Willoughby is almost blown away while struggling against a wind machine on This Morning
text:
Holly Willoughby got more than she bargained for on Tuesday's episode of This Morning as she struggled against a wind machine with co-host Phillip Schofield.

The TV presenter hosted a segment that aimed to show viewers what the best umbrellas for dealing with high winds on the market.

Holly, 38, began the segment by trying to open her umbrella and immediately struggled with it as Phillip, 57, braced himself for the machine.

Windy weather: Holly Willoughby, 38, got more than she bargained for on Tuesday's episode of This Morning as she struggled against a wind machine with co-host Phillip Schofield, 57

'I can't open it,' Holly could be heard saying as the wind machine began.

'Turn it the other way,' Phillip called to her as he tried to cope with the force of the wind.

Holly moved further back and turned around as she continued to try and get the umbrella open before she was handed a new one and faced the wind.

Her umbrella quickly turned inside out as she tried to cope with the furious winds from the machine.

Holly cut a stylish figure for Tuesday's episode of the chat show, donning a burgundy jumper and matching leather trousers with a flared leg.

The TV star also added height to her frame with a pair of maroon heels while styling her platinum blonde locks into loose waves.

It comes after Holly and Phillip are reportedly set to net £150,000 for working an extra half an hour each day on This Morning from January.

Following the cancellation of The Jeremy Kyle Show, ITV are revamping their schedule and This Morning's airtime is being extended by thirty minutes.

According to the Daily Mirror, insiders have revealed an extra £300,000 has been allocated to pay Holly and Phillip, 57, for their extra thirty minutes of hosting.

The presenting duo are currently paid £600,000 a year for their roles on This Morning after Holly's pay was brought in line with Phillip's in 2017.
